content: bag you re it knit top-down in the round with two short handles to stretch across a bagging frame at the grocery store the lace pattern is very stretchy and will hold as much as a standard plastic grocery bag the copy in italics explains things that i do you may choose to do otherwise but at least you ll know my method sz 8 16 circular needle and set of dpns size 6 7 or 8 whatever you have on hand since you only need them for the last few rounds i knit the handles firmly and the lace section at a relaxed and loose gauge if you are a naturally tight knitter best to go up a needle size for the lace section only 1 safety pin type marker and a yarn needle worsted cotton about 100 grams 3 5 oz handles note avoid bind off count confusion in this pattern if you count the stitches passed over you ll be fine in other words the first stitch you knit when starting the bind off section is not included in the count don t start counting until that stitch goes over the next one and so on when you finish the bind off the stitch that remains on right needle will be incorporated into the next knitted section as noted in directions cast on 84 sts i use the long tail cast on which is very stretchy place marker join and knit 9 rounds move marker up as you knit you ll need it all the way to the end next round *k10 k2tog bind off 18 sts place last st from bind off on left total 44 sts needle and k2tog k10 repeat from * with two big gaps with backward loops next round *k11 cast on 10 sts k11 repeat from * total 64 sts prevent the dreaded notch that appears at the beginning of bind off section before knitting the 11th stitch pass the front strand of the first bind off stitch over it then knit it wordy explanation when you get to that last stitch take the left needle out of it it won t go anywhere and use it to pick up the front strand of the first bind off stitch and then return the abandoned stitch to the needle then use the right needle to lift that bind off strand over the live stitch then knit the stitch that closes up the gap that always appears between live stitch section and beginning of a bind off it s not absolutely necessary but it reinforces what i consider to be a point of weakness and looks better next round *k11 knit 14 sts across 10 st cast on section by interspersing four m1 sts in the slack that appears between sts as you knit they can be m1r or m1l depending on how you made the cast on loops in total 72 sts previous round just make them to match k11 repeat from
